sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a trapezium.
message_1: A trapezium has parallel sides of lengths 8 cm and 12 cm. The non-parallel sides have lengths 5 cm and 7 cm. Find the perimeter of the trapezium.
message_2:
To find the perimeter of the trapezium, we simply need to add the lengths of all four sides. 

Perimeter = length of side 1 + length of side 2 + length of side 3 + length of side 4

The parallel sides have lengths 8 cm and 12 cm, and the non-parallel sides have lengths 5 cm and 7 cm.

Perimeter = 8 cm + 12 cm + 5 cm + 7 cm

Perimeter = 20 cm + 12 cm

Perimeter = 32 cm

The perimeter of the trapezium is 32 cm.
